meanings.definition: A person who participates in a lynching.
meanings.sent1: The lyncher was part of the group that carried out the lynching.
meanings.sent2: The town was shocked to discover that their neighbor was a lyncher.
meanings.sent3: The lyncher accidentally tripped over his own rope during the lynching.
meanings.sent4: In the old western movies, the lyncher was always portrayed as a ruthless individual.
meanings.sent5: The lyncher's face was hidden behind a mask, adding to the fear of the lynching.

meanings.sent1: He decided to lyncher the accused without a fair trial.
meanings.sent2: The mob planned to lyncher the suspect before the authorities arrived.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends joked that they would lyncher each other in the game they were playing.
meanings.sent4: The angry crowd wanted to lyncher the criminal for his heinous crime.
meanings.sent5: The vigilantes were ready to lyncher anyone they deemed guilty of wrongdoing.
